intro: Lactuca gorganica, commonly known as the Gorgan lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in temperate climates. The plant features upright stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a composite head similar to that of dandelions. Lactuca gorganica is primarily cultivated for its edible leaves, which have a mild, slightly bitter taste.
